text: Psalm 94
A Prayer for Retribution against Oppressors
O Yahweh, God of vengeance,
God of vengeance, shine forth.
Rise up, O Judge of the earth.
Repay upon the proud what is \add their\add* rightful due.
How long \add will the\add* wicked, O Yahweh,
how long will \add the\add* wicked exult?
⸤They gush words⸥\f + \fr 94:4 \ft Literally “They gush, they speak,” which is probably a hendiadys \f* unrestrained.
All \add the\add* evildoers boast.
They crush your people, O Yahweh;
they oppress your inheritance.
They kill widow and stranger,
and they murder orphans,
while\f + \fr 94:7 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* they say, “Yah\f + \fr 94:7 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f* does not see,”
and “The God of Jacob does not pay attention.”
You pay attention, O brutes among the people.
And \add you\add* fools, when you will show insight?
Will \add the\add* one who planted \add the\add* ear not hear?
Will \add the\add* one who formed \add the\add* eye not see?
Will \add the\add* one who instructs nations not rebuke,
the one who teaches humankind knowledge?
Yahweh knows \add the\add* thoughts of humankind,
that ⸤they \add are\add* to no purpose⸥.\f + \fr 94:11 \ft Literally “they \fq are \ft a breath” or “a vanity” \f*
Blessed \add is\add* the man, O Yah, whom you instruct
and teach from your law,
to give him rest from days of trouble,
until a pit is dug for the wicked.
For Yahweh will not abandon his people,
nor forsake his inheritance.
For judgment will return to righteousness,\f + \fr 94:15 \ft That is, the court system will operate correctly \f*
and all the upright in heart \add will follow\add* after it.
Who rose up for me against \add the\add* wicked?
Who stood up for me against \add the\add* workers of iniquity?
If Yahweh had not been my help,
my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.
When I thought,\f + \fr 94:18 \ft Hebrew “If/When I said,” that is, said to myself \f* “My foot is slipping,”
your loyal love, O Yahweh, supported me.
When my troubled thoughts were many ⸤within me⸥,\f + \fr 94:19 \ft Literally “in my inward parts” \f*
your consolations cheered my soul.
Can there be allied with you a throne of destruction,
one that forms trouble based on statute?
They band together against \add the\add* life of \add the\add* righteous,
and declare \add the\add* blameless guilty of blood.\f + \fr 94:21 \ft Or “condemn innocent blood” \f*
But Yahweh has become my \add high\add* stronghold,
and my God \add has become\add* my rock of refuge.
And he will repay on them their iniquity,
and by\f + \fr 94:23 \ft Or “in” \f* their evil he will destroy them.
Yahweh our God will destroy them.
